title: Authors and Citation
text: Landau WM, Gao C (2025). multiverse.internals: Internal Infrastructure R-multiverse. R package version 0.4.10, https://github.com/r-multiverse/multiverse.internals, https://r-multiverse.org/multiverse.internals/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {multiverse.internals: Internal Infrastructure for R-multiverse},   author = {William Michael Landau and Charlie Gao},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.4.10,   https://github.com/r-multiverse/multiverse.internals},   url = {https://r-multiverse.org/multiverse.internals/}, }

title: Internal Infrastructure for R-multiverse
text: multiverse.internals R package support internal infrastructure R-multiverse project. learn specific pieces R-multiverse infrastructure reviewing checking packages, please visit https://r-multiverse.org/multiverse.internals/reference/index.html.

what: Build an R-universe packages.json manifest from a collection of text file contributions with individual package URLs. — aggregate_contributions

title: Build an R-universe packages.json manifest from a collection of text file contributions with individual package URLs. — aggregate_contributions
code: aggregate_contributions(   input = getwd(),   output = "packages.json",   owner_exceptions = character(0L) )

title: Build an R-universe packages.json manifest from a collection of text file contributions with individual package URLs. — aggregate_contributions
text: input Character length 1, directory path text file listings R releases. output Character length 1, file path R-universe packages.json file written. owner_exceptions Character vector URLs GitHub owners "branch": "*release" omitted. Example: "https://github.com/cran".

title: Build an R-universe packages.json manifest from a collection of text file contributions with individual package URLs. — aggregate_contributions
text: NULL (invisibly)

what: Filter PACKAGES and PACKAGES.gz metadata files. — filter_meta

text: Filter PACKAGES PACKAGES.gz files list certain packages.

title: Filter PACKAGES and PACKAGES.gz metadata files. — filter_meta
Filter PACKAGES and PACKAGES.gz metadata files. — filter_meta
text: path_meta Directory path PACKAGES PACKAGES.gz files reside locally. path_staging Path GitHub clone Staging universe.

title: Filter PACKAGES and PACKAGES.gz metadata files. — filter_meta
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ path_meta <- tempfile() dir.create(path_meta) mock <- system.file(   file.path("mock", "meta"),   package = "multiverse.internals",   mustWork = TRUE ) file.copy(mock, path_meta, recursive = TRUE) path_staging <- tempfile() url_staging <- "https://github.com/r-multiverse/staging" gert::git_clone(url = url_staging, path = path_staging) filter_meta(path_meta, path_staging) } # }

title: Freeze dependencies — freeze_dependencies
text: Freeze targeted versions base R CRAN packages.

title: Freeze dependencies — freeze_dependencies
text: path_staging Character string, directory path source files Staging universe. path_community Character string, local directory path clone Community universe GitHub repository.

title: Freeze dependencies — freeze_dependencies
text: NULL (invisibly)

title: Freeze dependencies — freeze_dependencies
text: freeze_dependencies() runs month-long dependency freeze phase Staging base R CRAN packages locked Staging universe next Production snapshot. establishes checks Staging universe using exact set dependencies used candidate freeze (see stage_candidates()). freeze_dependencies() copies Community repository packages.json Staging repository reset Staging process. also writes config.json file date targeted CRAN snapshot.

title: Freeze dependencies — freeze_dependencies
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ url_staging = "https://github.com/r-multiverse/staging" url_community = "https://github.com/r-multiverse/community" path_staging <- tempfile() path_community <- tempfile() gert::git_clone(url = url_staging, path = path_staging) gert::git_clone(url = url_community, path = path_community) freeze_dependencies(   path_staging = path_staging,   path_community = path_community ) } # }

what: Report issues from R-universe package check results. — issues_checks
title: Report issues from R-universe package check results. — issues_checks
text: Check R-universe package check results.

title: Report issues from R-universe package check results. — issues_checks
Report issues from R-universe package check results. — issues_checks
text: meta data frame R-universe package check results returned meta_checks().

title: Report issues from R-universe package check results. — issues_checks
text: named list information packages comply DESCRPTION checks. name package name, element contains specific information non-compliance.

title: Report issues from R-universe package check results. — issues_checks
text: issues_checks() reads output R-universe check API scan R-multiverse packages issues may happened building testing.

title: Report issues from R-universe package check results. — issues_checks
text: Functions like issues_versions() issues_descriptions() perform health checks packages R-multiverse. complete list checks, see issues_*() functions listed https://r-multiverse.org/multiverse.internals/reference/index.html. record_versions() updates version number history releases R-multiverse, record_issues() gathers together issues R-multiverse packages.

title: Report issues from R-universe package check results. — issues_checks
code: meta <- meta_checks(repo = "https://wlandau.r-universe.dev")   issues <- issues_checks(meta = meta)   str(issues) #> List of 1 #>  $ autometric:List of 2 #>   ..$ url   : chr "https://github.com/r-universe/wlandau/actions/runs/13277554136" #>   ..$ issues:List of 1 #>   .. ..$ linux: chr "MISSING"

title: Report package dependency issues — issues_dependencies
text: Flag packages issues strong dependencies (Imports:, Depends:, LinkingTo: DESCRIPTION.) include indirect/upstream dependencies, well, just explicit mentions DESCRIPTION file.

title: Report package dependency issues — issues_dependencies
text: packages Character vector names packages issues. meta data frame R-universe package check results returned meta_checks(). verbose TRUE print progress checking issues dependencies, FALSE otherwise.

title: Report package dependency issues — issues_dependencies
text: nested list problems triggered dependencies. names top-level elements packages affected downstream. value top-level element list whose names element inner list character vector relevant dependencies downstream package. example, consider linear dependency graph crew.cluster depends crew, crew depends mirai, mirai depends nanonext. represent graph like : nanonext -> mirai -> crew -> crew.cluster. nanonext issue, issues_dependencies() returns list(crew.cluster = list(nanonext = "crew"), ...), ... stands additional named list entries. list, deduce nanonext causing issue affecting crew.cluster direct dependency crew. choice output format issues_dependencies() allows package maintainers easily figure direct dependencies contributing issues drop direct dependencies necessary.

title: Report package dependency issues — issues_dependencies
text: Functions like issues_versions() issues_descriptions() perform health checks packages R-multiverse. complete list checks, see issues_*() functions listed https://r-multiverse.org/multiverse.internals/reference/index.html. record_versions() updates version number history releases R-multiverse, record_issues() gathers together issues R-multiverse packages.

title: Report package dependency issues — issues_dependencies
code: meta <- meta_packages(repo = "https://wlandau.r-universe.dev")   issues_dependencies(packages = character(0L), meta = meta) #> list()   issues_dependencies(packages = "crew.aws.batch", meta = meta) #> list()   issues_dependencies(packages = "nanonext", meta = meta) #> $mirai #> $mirai$nanonext #> character(0) #>  #>  #> $crew #> $crew$nanonext #> [1] "mirai" #>  #>  #> $crew.aws.batch #> $crew.aws.batch$nanonext #> [1] "crew" #>  #>  #> $crew.cluster #> $crew.cluster$nanonext #> [1] "crew" #>  #>    issues_dependencies(packages = "crew", meta = meta) #> $crew.aws.batch #> $crew.aws.batch$crew #> character(0) #>  #>  #> $crew.cluster #> $crew.cluster$crew #> character(0) #>  #>    issues_dependencies(packages = c("crew", "mirai"), meta = meta) #> $crew.aws.batch #> $crew.aws.batch$crew #> character(0) #>  #> $crew.aws.batch$mirai #> [1] "crew" #>  #>  #> $crew.cluster #> $crew.cluster$crew #> character(0) #>  #> $crew.cluster$mirai #> [1] "crew" #>  #>  #> $crew #> $crew$mirai #> character(0) #>  #>

text: meta data frame R-universe package check results returned meta_checks().

title: Report DESCRIPTION-level issues. — issues_descriptions

title: Report DESCRIPTION-level issues. — issues_descriptions
text: issues_descriptions() reports specific issues DESCRIPTION-level metadata packages: Security advisories https://github.com/RConsortium/r-advisory-database. Licenses verified free open-source. presence "Remotes" field. lower version number R-multiverse CRAN, package also published .

title: Report DESCRIPTION-level issues. — issues_descriptions
text: Functions like issues_versions() issues_descriptions() perform health checks packages R-multiverse. complete list checks, see issues_*() functions listed https://r-multiverse.org/multiverse.internals/reference/index.html. record_versions() updates version number history releases R-multiverse, record_issues() gathers together issues R-multiverse packages.

title: Report DESCRIPTION-level issues. — issues_descriptions
code: meta <- meta_packages(repo = "https://wlandau.r-universe.dev")   issues <- issues_descriptions(meta = meta)   str(issues) #>  list()

title: Check package versions. — issues_versions
text: Check package version number history compliance.

title: Check package versions. — issues_versions
text: versions Character length 1, file path JSON manifest tracking history released versions packages.

title: Check package versions. — issues_versions
text: named list information packages comply version number history checks. name package name, element contains specific information version non-compliance: current version number, current version hash, analogous versions hashes highest-versioned release recorded.

title: Check package versions. — issues_versions
text: function checks version number history packages R-multiverse reports packages issues. current released version given package must unique, must greater versions previous package releases.

title: Check package versions. — issues_versions
text: Functions like issues_versions() issues_descriptions() perform health checks packages R-multiverse. complete list checks, see issues_*() functions listed https://r-multiverse.org/multiverse.internals/reference/index.html. record_versions() updates version number history releases R-multiverse, record_issues() gathers together issues R-multiverse packages.

title: Check package versions. — issues_versions
code: lines <- c(     "[",     " {",     " \"package\": \"package_unmodified\",",     " \"version_current\": \"1.0.0\",",     " \"hash_current\": \"hash_1.0.0\",",     " \"version_highest\": \"1.0.0\",",     " \"hash_highest\": \"hash_1.0.0\"",     " },",     " {",     " \"package\": \"version_decremented\",",     " \"version_current\": \"0.0.1\",",     " \"hash_current\": \"hash_0.0.1\",",     " \"version_highest\": \"1.0.0\",",     " \"hash_highest\": \"hash_1.0.0\"",     " },",     " {",     " \"package\": \"version_incremented\",",     " \"version_current\": \"2.0.0\",",     " \"hash_current\": \"hash_2.0.0\",",     " \"version_highest\": \"2.0.0\",",     " \"hash_highest\": \"hash_2.0.0\"",     " },",     " {",     " \"package\": \"version_unmodified\",",     " \"version_current\": \"1.0.0\",",     " \"hash_current\": \"hash_1.0.0-modified\",",     " \"version_highest\": \"1.0.0\",",     " \"hash_highest\": \"hash_1.0.0\"",     " }",     "]"   )   versions <- tempfile()   writeLines(lines, versions)   out <- issues_versions(versions)   str(out) #> List of 2 #>  $ version_decremented:List of 4 #>   ..$ version_current: chr "0.0.1" #>   ..$ hash_current   : chr "hash_0.0.1" #>   ..$ version_highest: chr "1.0.0" #>   ..$ hash_highest   : chr "hash_1.0.0" #>  $ version_unmodified :List of 4 #>   ..$ version_current: chr "1.0.0" #>   ..$ hash_current   : chr "hash_1.0.0-modified" #>   ..$ version_highest: chr "1.0.0" #>   ..$ hash_highest   : chr "hash_1.0.0"

title: List package metadata — meta_packages
text: List package metadata R universe.

title: List package metadata — meta_packages
text: repo Character length 1, URL package repository. R-multiverse uses "https://community.r-multiverse.org". fields Character string fields query.

title: List package metadata — meta_packages
text: data frame one row per package columns package metadata. important columns : package: character vector package names. version: character vector package versions repo. license: character vector license names. remotesha: character vector GitHub/GitLab commit hashes. remotes: list character vectors dependencies Remotes: field DESCRIPTION files. foss: TRUE package valid free open-source license, FALSE otherwise. cran: character vector versions. version version package CRAN first day recent R-multiverse staging period.

title: Record package issues. — record_issues
text: repo Character length 1, URL package repository. R-multiverse uses "https://community.r-multiverse.org". versions Character length 1, file path JSON manifest tracking history released versions packages. output Character length 1, file path JSON file record new package issues. call record_issues() overwrites contents file. mock testing purposes , named list data frames inputs various intermediate functions. verbose TRUE print progress checking issues dependencies, FALSE otherwise.

title: Record package issues. — record_issues
text: NULL (invisibly).

title: Record package issues. — record_issues
text: Functions like issues_versions() issues_descriptions() perform health checks packages R-multiverse. complete list checks, see issues_*() functions listed https://r-multiverse.org/multiverse.internals/reference/index.html. record_versions() updates version number history releases R-multiverse, record_issues() gathers together issues R-multiverse packages.

title: Record package issues. — record_issues
text: package observed problems, record_issues() writes JSON list entry output JSON file one element type failing check. check-specific element informative name (example, checks, descriptions, versions) list diagnostic information. addition, date field indicate issue first detected. date automatically resets next time issues package resolved.

title: Record package issues. — record_issues
code: repo <- "https://wlandau.r-universe.dev"   output <- tempfile()   versions <- tempfile()   record_versions(     versions = versions,     repo = repo   )   record_issues(     repo = repo,     versions = versions,     output = output   )   writeLines(readLines(output)) #> { #>   "autometric": { #>     "checks": { #>       "url": ["https://github.com/r-universe/wlandau/actions/runs/13277554136"], #>       "issues": { #>         "linux": ["MISSING"] #>       } #>     }, #>     "success": [false], #>     "date": ["2025-03-12"], #>     "version": ["0.1.2.9000"], #>     "remote_hash": ["13ec8d2cfba955081cf3e19eb5e74af07ba89bef"] #>   }, #>   "crew": { #>     "success": [true], #>     "date": ["2025-03-12"], #>     "version": ["1.0.0.9001"], #>     "remote_hash": ["7d460e26f4c45233bee15ff4db9564503ec4b21a"] #>   }, #>   "crew.aws.batch": { #>     "success": [true], #>     "date": ["2025-03-12"], #>     "version": ["0.0.8"], #>     "remote_hash": ["136fedb9df30123b7c216ac75a66f29e8e94f2c1"] #>   }, #>   "crew.cluster": { #>     "success": [true], #>     "date": ["2025-03-12"], #>     "version": ["0.3.4.9000"], #>     "remote_hash": ["f9ecd38a1b8736157b06635f5e0cb43cb80c09a4"] #>   }, #>   "mirai": { #>     "success": [true], #>     "date": ["2025-03-12"], #>     "version": ["2.1.0.9001"], #>     "remote_hash": ["8747429e052e3901dec27f0c2544d6556c297e87"] #>   }, #>   "nanonext": { #>     "success": [true], #>     "date": ["2025-03-12"], #>     "version": ["1.5.1.9001"], #>     "remote_hash": ["77b1cac28f96ab4f48007f37d0a2de1f8a1357ad"] #>   } #> }

title: Record nonstandard licenses — record_nonstandard_licenses
text: R-multiverse packages must valid free open-source (FOSS) licenses protect intellectual property rights package owners (c.f. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Free_and_open-source_software). record_nonstandard_licenses() records packages nonstandard licenses.

title: Record the manifest of package versions. — record_versions

title: Record the manifest of package versions. — record_versions
text: function tracks manifest containing current version, current hash, highest version ever released, hash highest version ever released. issues_versions() uses information determine whether package complies best practices version numbers.

text: Functions like issues_versions() issues_descriptions() perform health checks packages R-multiverse. complete list checks, see issues_*() functions listed https://r-multiverse.org/multiverse.internals/reference/index.html. record_versions() updates version number history releases R-multiverse, record_issues() gathers together issues R-multiverse packages.

title: Review an R-multiverse contribution — review_pull_request
text: Review pull request add packages R-multiverse.

title: Review an R-multiverse contribution — review_pull_request
code: review_pull_request(   owner = "r-multiverse",   repo = "contributions",   number,   advisories = character(0L),   organizations = character(0L) )

title: Review an R-multiverse contribution — review_pull_request
text: owner Character length 1, name package repository owner. repo Character length 1, URL package repository. R-multiverse uses "https://community.r-multiverse.org". number Positive integer length 1, index pull request repo. advisories Character vector names packages advisories R Consortium Advisory Database. organizations Character vector names GitHub organizations. Pull requests authors members least one organizations flagged manual review.

title: Stage release candidates — stage_candidates
text: NULL (invisibly)

title: Stage release candidates — stage_candidates
text: stage_candidates() implements candidate freeze month-long period prior Production snapshot. Packages pass R-multiverse checks frozen (allowed update ) staged Production. Packages least one failing staged Production, maintainers can update new GitHub/GitLab releases. stage_candidates() writes packages.json control contents Staging universe.

title: Stage release candidates — stage_candidates
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ url_staging <- "https://github.com/r-multiverse/staging" path_staging <- tempfile() gert::git_clone(url = url_staging, path = path_staging) stage_candidates(path_staging = path_staging) } # }

what: Update the package status repository — update_status
title: Update the package status repository — update_status
text: Update repository reports status individual packages.

title: Update the package status repository — update_status
Update the package status repository — update_status
text: path_status Character string, directory path source files package status repository. path_staging Character string, local directory path clone Staging universe GitHub repository. path_community Character string, local directory path clone Community universe GitHub repository.

title: Update the package status repository — update_status
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ url_staging = "https://github.com/r-multiverse/staging" url_community = "https://github.com/r-multiverse/community" path_status <- tempfile() path_staging <- tempfile() path_community <- tempfile() gert::git_clone(url = url_staging, path = path_staging) gert::git_clone(url = url_community, path = path_community) update_status(   path_status = path_status,   path_staging = path_staging,   path_community = path_community ) writeLines(   readLines(     file.path(path_status, "community", "multiverse.internals.html")   ) ) writeLines(   readLines(     file.path(path_status, "community", "multiverse.internals.xml")   ) ) } # }

title: multiverse.internals 0.4.10
text: Simplify stage_candidates() rclone_includes(): get remote hashes pre-recorded issues.json, opposed separate call meta_packages(). ensures remote hashes contemporaneous corresponding reported check results.

title: multiverse.internals 0.4.9
text: stage_candidates(), set "branch": "*release" Staging allow broken packages update faster. stage_candidates(), ensure removing package Community automatically remove Staging candidate freeze. Avoid need staged.json. Simplifies multiverse.internals lot, especially stage_candidates().

title: multiverse.internals 0.4.8
text: Sort staged.json.

title: multiverse.internals 0.4.7
text: Remove types argument stage_candidates().

title: multiverse.internals 0.4.6
text: Add rclone_includes().

title: multiverse.internals 0.4.5
text: Replace snapshot.url Rclone filters. Add filter_packages()

title: multiverse.internals 0.4.4
text: Implement separate freezes dependencies release candidates (#146). Add freeze_dependencies().

title: multiverse.internals 0.4.3
text: Consolidate snapshot metadata management meta_snapshot(). Subsume update_staging() propose_snapshot() stage_candidates(). Rename freeze.json staged.json. Rename meta.json snapshot.json. Write production.html page update_status().

title: multiverse.internals 0.4.2
text: Rearrange fields meta.json. Remove superfluous snapshot.json file.

title: multiverse.internals 0.4.1
text: Restructure meta.json better maintain snapshot archive.

title: multiverse.internals 0.4.0
text: Organize R version snapshot/staging date information neatly meta.json. Use new skip_packages parameter R-universe snapshot API. Disallow packages enter leave Staging universe packages.json Staging period. Record healthy packages record_issues() support .

title: multiverse.internals 0.3.9
text: Target Linux R-release instead Linux R-devel (#112).

title: multiverse.internals 0.3.8
text: status repo, list packages check issues Community Staging.

title: multiverse.internals 0.3.7
text: Shift yearly Staging schedule begin January end December. Freeze targeted base R version start Staging quarter.

title: multiverse.internals 0.3.6
text: Detect source failures issues. Flag R-multiverse packages whose CRAN versions day Staging freeze higher current versions R-multiverse. Use whole R version propose_snapshot() downstream automation can grep snapshot URL version instead needing install R rversions package. Write config.json Staging select CRAN snapshot start freeze.

title: multiverse.internals 0.3.5
text: Depend R >= 4.4.0 base coalescing operator %||%. snapshot binaries current R release.

title: multiverse.internals 0.3.4
text: Use <pre> render YAML HTML.

title: multiverse.internals 0.3.3
text: Remove superfluous text replacement status system.

title: multiverse.internals 0.3.2
text: Use _binaries field R-universe check API. Enforce R CMD check errors warnings. Report check errors clearly. Make easy add/remove check platforms R versions enforce.

title: multiverse.internals 0.3.1
text: Add extra checks Authors@R assert_parsed_description().

title: multiverse.internals 0.3.0.9000 (development)
text: Test update_topics() empty topic.

title: multiverse.internals 0.3.0
text: Add update_topics().

title: multiverse.internals 0.2.21
text: Add back HTML line breaks update_status().

title: multiverse.internals 0.2.20
text: Ensure valid RSS feeds created update_status().

title: multiverse.internals 0.2.19
text: Fix help file examples record_issues(). Link RSS feed status page.

title: multiverse.internals 0.2.18
text: Use single JSON file upstream issue data. Rename interpret_issue() interpret_status(). Add update_status().

title: multiverse.internals 0.2.17
text: Align contribution reviews revised review policy https://github.com/r-multiverse/r-multiverse.github.io/pull/33.

title: multiverse.internals 0.2.16
text: Add interpret_issue() help create RSS feeds. Add record_nonstandard_licenses()

title: multiverse.internals 0.2.14
text: Allow update_staging() work staging packages.json exist. Remove staging_is_resetting() rely cron syntax https://github.com/r-multiverse/staging/pull/3 schedule management staging universe.

title: multiverse.internals 0.2.13
text: Record issues vulnerabilities https://github.com/RConsortium/r-advisory-database.

title: multiverse.internals 0.2.12
text: Amend argument defaults propose_snapshot() include source files.

title: multiverse.internals 0.2.11
text: Implement propose_snapshot(). Exempt Production WASM checks.

title: multiverse.internals 0.2.10
text: Implement freezing mechanism update_staging(). Implement staging_is_active() detect staging universe active.

title: multiverse.internals 0.2.9
text: Implement community/staging idea (@jeroen).

title: multiverse.internals 0.2.8
text: merge contributions created web interface.

title: multiverse.internals 0.2.7
text: Exclude superfluous fields update_production() packages.json. Require verified commits contributions.

title: multiverse.internals 0.2.6
text: Add update_production().

title: multiverse.internals 0.2.4
text: Updates R-Multiverse repository community.r-multiverse.org. Makes meta_checks() meta_packages() robust trailing slashes supplied URL. Repair issues_dependencies() empty graphs.

title: multiverse.internals 0.2.2
text: Add issues_dependencies().

title: multiverse.internals 0.2.1
text: Bump version trigger rebuild.

title: multiverse.internals 0.2.0
text: Add checks record_issues(): results R-universe check API, plus specific results package DESCRIPTION files. Refactor document specific checks check_checks(), check_descriptions(), check_versions(). Add pkgdown website.

title: multiverse.internals 0.1.4
text: write version_issues.json record_versions(). Record version issues separate JSON files new record_issues() function. Going forward, function also write R-universe check results individual package-specific files.

title: multiverse.internals 0.1.3
text: record_versions(), left-join old versions new versions avoid spamming versions.json unbounded list renamed abandoned packages.

title: multiverse.internals 0.1.2
text: Remove URL reference.

title: multiverse.internals 0.1.1
text: Rename internal functions arguments.

title: multiverse.internals 0.1.0
